salary increase
base salary

Main rules and conditions for salary increase, review periods, responsible persons and more.

scheduled review unscheduled review
planned review
1
principles
of
salary
review
principle 1
The review is conducted within the framework of the employee's current position. If the offer included a condition for changing the salary after the probation period, this change is not considered a review and is not submitted in the salary adjustment list.
principle 2
The department head evaluates the work of their employees and their own (if necessary), and determines the list of review participants. If an employee changes position, they may be added to the general list under standard conditions only if approval of the change is required from the department head.
principle 3
The manager determines the new salary amounts according to the matrix, market salaries for similar positions, and the timing of the previous review.
principle 4
The manager prepares a written justification for the review for each employee, including for their own work (see section "Requirements for justifications").

Main
conditions
this is the baseline
Company tenure
At least 6 months from the date of employment in the current team
Salary position relative to the market
Midpoint, but not above the 50–75th percentile
Date of last salary review
At least 1 year ago
Salary increase percentage
From 6% to 20%
Salary review occurs twice a year at specified periods
  • from May 1 to July 1;
  • from October 1 to December 1
Approval required
Yes
responsible parties
Direct manager
and/or department head
The manager informs HR about the need to review salaries for their team, provides job descriptions for the positions if necessary, and prepares written justifications for the review for each employee.
Manager and HR
The manager and HR collect data. HR assists in preparing the approval forms considering all described criteria. Manager and HR determine the % of salary increase based on market data and other factors.
Division C-Level Head
HR provides a completed salary review form separately for each team.
HR
HR requests and prepares market analytics.
All requests must go through mandatory approval by the Division Head.
2
matrix
for
%
salary
review
Employee indicators and maximum allowed %
of planned salary increase
Working with the matrix to determine the salary review amount and market data by position
The following factors are considered when determining the % of salary review:
At least 6 months from the date of employment in the current team
Market data for the position, which is based on job descriptions and salary research. We use 5 salary surveys provided by well-known consulting firms, including those covering positions in our business sector.
For mass positions, salary amounts may also take into account values of salaries for similar positions within Alexey Bobrov’s structure.
matrix – is it like a movie?
When working with the table of market salary values, we focus on the Midpoint, not exceeding the 75th percentile.

example
of

display
market
salary
4
main
rules
Conditions for participation in the review:
1
An employee can undergo a salary review no more than once a year.
2
If an employee received a raise in one of the periods (for example, a request submitted from May 15 to May 30, 2025), the next review can only take place in the corresponding period of the following year.
3
The possibility of a repeat review within the same year is an exception and is allowed only by the decision of the Division Head in case of exceptional achievements.
4
The review process for Cyprus is separate, usually occurring from July 1 and January 1 within the Cyprus offices for all types of employee arrangements. HR BP of the division provides detailed information.
us with Bro after the salary review
Review for managers
1
Salary reviews for managers are conducted together
with their team.
2
In the approval form, the manager adds justification in the format of a report for the entire division, including personal achievements that impacted the long-term team results.
3
The review decision is made by the Division Head.
4
Decisions are made during the review periods — June and November.
submission
deadlines
for materials
In case of approval
  • Changes take effect from July 1 / December 1.
  • Salary for July / December will be recalculated based on the new salary.
For Cyprus
  • Review periods are usually from July 1 and January 1.
  • For the current year, HR BP of the division provides details on timing and specifics.
not today
refusal
for
review
Applications that do not meet the criteria or are submitted outside the established deadlines are considered exclusively in agreement with the Division Head and HR.
Lack of written justification, missing information about previous review dates, or incomplete form submission are grounds for application rejection.
5
step-by-step
instruction
1
The manager fills out the salary review form for their employees and themselves (if applicable), compiles the list of employees, and describes the grounds for the review. Determines new salaries according to the review matrix. The completed form is sent to HR BP — Ekaterina Andreeva (reddy 71351766624).
2
HR BP checks the forms, requests and adds market data if necessary, and conducts a briefing on the completed form with the manager to finalize the salary review percentage for each position.
3
The team manager submits the form to the Division Head and waits for approval. Upon request, HR BP can also send the form for approval.
4
HR monitors the approval of each request and coordinates the transfer of updated salary data to those responsible for payroll.
free cheese
is only
free
6
requirements
for
justifications
Justifications are provided for each employee individually. General justifications can be described for a series of identical mass positions, provided that the review percentage is the same for each position in the series.
When preparing a justification
for a managerial role, in addition to the above, the results of the team's work and the manager's impact on these results are described.
Justifications may include,
but are not limited to: description of work volumes (including numerical performance data), achievements, taking on additional responsibilities, leadership tasks, assessment of employee initiative, and overall feedback from the manager regarding work performed during the period.

unscheduled review
Where is the salary?
The justification for an unscheduled salary review may include the criteria listed below, as well as the need to retain the employee.
work?
wolf
criteria
Unique knowledge, experience, and competencies that are important for the team right now.
Familiarity with systems developed internally within the company, unique products.
Responsible for critical processes/projects within the division.
Such employees do not exist in other units of the division.
Employee departure causes clear damage and measurable costs
for the division.
Demonstrates exceptional performance.
Such employees are scarce on the market and difficult to replace (time-consuming, costly).
Launched a project that brings long-term benefits /
impacts the financial results of the division.
Holds specific education/certificates/licenses.

WHAT
PROCESS
1
The manager identifies the need for an unscheduled review, prepares a written justification,
fills out the form, and submits it to HR BP.
2
HR requests and enters market analytics into the form, providing comments on the process.
3
The team manager submits the form to the Division Head and waits for approval. The manager and HR determine the % increase based on the data in the form.
4
HR provides the manager with the completed form for the salary review separately for each team.
